TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit IcmpV4Statistics extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides Internet Control Message Protocol for IPv4 (ICMPv4) statistical data for the local computer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ICMPv4 is a set of error and informational messages for use with Internet Protocol version 4. ICMP version 4 is defined in IETF RFC 792.
This class is used by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalProperties.GetIcmpV4Statistics%2A> method to return ICMPv4 traffic information.
## Examples The following example displays the current ICMPv4 statistics.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfoReport#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfoReport/CPP/netinfo.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfoReport#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfoReport/CS/netinfo.cs#6)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor can be called only by classes that derive from <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IcmpV4Statistics>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property AddressMaskRepliesReceived As Long
public: abstract property long AddressMaskRepliesReceived { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Control Message Protocol version 4 (ICMPv4) Address Mask Reply messages that were received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of Address Mask Reply messages that were received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Address Mask Request and Reply messages are used to determine the number of bits in the subnet mask for the local subnet.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property DestinationUnreachableMessagesReceived As Long
public: abstract property long DestinationUnreachableMessagesReceived { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Control Message Protocol version 4 (ICMPv4) messages that were received because of a packet having an unreachable address in its destination.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of Destination Unreachable messages that were received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A Destination Unreachable message can be sent to the computer that is the source of a packet for any of the following reasons:
- The computer cannot find a route to the destination address.
- Communication with the destination address is administratively prohibited. For example, a firewall prevents delivery of packets to the destination.
- The destination address is unreachable.
- The destination port is unreachable. For example, there is no listener available for the packet's protocol.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#23](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#23)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#23](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#23)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#23](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#23)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property DestinationUnreachableMessagesSent As Long
public: abstract property long DestinationUnreachableMessagesSent { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Control Message Protocol version 4 (ICMPv4) messages that were sent because of a packet having an unreachable address in its destination.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of Destination Unreachable messages sent.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A Destination Unreachable message can be sent to the computer that is the source of a packet for any of the following reasons:
- The computer cannot find a route to the destination address.
- Communication with the destination address is administratively prohibited. For example, a firewall prevents delivery of packets to the destination.
- The destination address is unreachable.
- The destination port is unreachable. For example, there is no listener available for the packet's protocol.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#23](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#23)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#23](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#23)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#23](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#23)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property EchoRepliesReceived As Long
public: abstract property long EchoRepliesReceived { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Control Message Protocol version 4 (ICMPv4) Echo Reply messages that were received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of number of ICMP Echo Reply messages that were received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Echo Request and Echo Reply messages allow a computer to request an ICMP response from a remote computer on a network. This functionality is often used to determine the validity of remote addresses.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#21](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#21)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#21](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#21)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#21](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#21)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Control Message Protocol messages that were received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of ICMPv4 messages that were received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ICMPv4 messages are sent to communicate errors and information about packets that were sent using the Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4).
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ParameterProblemsReceived As Long
public: abstract property long ParameterProblemsReceived { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Control Message Protocol version 4 (ICMPv4) Parameter Problem messages that were received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages that were received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Parameter Problem messages are sent when a host computer or router encounters problems while processing the contents of a packet header, such as encountering an invalid IPv4 option or an invalid Next Header type.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#27](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#27)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#27](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#27)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#27](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#27)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Control Message Protocol version 4 (ICMPv4) Redirect messages that were received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of ICMP Redirect messages that were received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Redirect messages are sent by routers to inform a host computer of a better route for a destination address.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#25](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#25)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#25](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#25)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#25](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#25)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property SourceQuenchesReceived As Long
public: abstract property long SourceQuenchesReceived { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Control Message Protocol version 4 (ICMPv4) Source Quench messages that were received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of Source Quench messages that were received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Source Quench messages are sent when a packet was discarded because of insufficient space in the output queue. A destination computer can also send a Source Quench message if packets arrive too quickly to be processed. The source quench message is a request to the host to cut back the rate at which it is sending traffic to the Internet destination.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#24](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#24)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#24](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#24)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#24](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#24)]

public: abstract property long SourceQuenchesSent { long get(); };

Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of Source Quench messages that were sent.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Source Quench messages are sent when a packet was discarded because of insufficient space in the output queue. A destination computer can also send a Source Quench message if packets arrive too quickly to be processed. The source quench message is a request to the host to cut back the rate at which it is sending traffic to the Internet destination.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property TimeExceededMessagesReceived As Long
public: abstract property long TimeExceededMessagesReceived { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Control Message Protocol version 4 (ICMPv4) Time Exceeded messages that were received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages that were received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A packet's Hop Limit determines how many times it can be forwarded before it is discarded. Each time a packet is forwarded, its Hop Limit value is decremented by one. When the Hop Limit reaches zero or when a router receives a packet with its Hop Limit set to zero, the packet is discarded and the source of the packet receives a Time Exceeded message indicating that the initial Hop Limit was too small or that the packet was caught in a routing loop.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#26](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#26)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#26](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#26)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#26](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#26)]

public: abstract property long TimeExceededMessagesSent { long get(); };

Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages that were sent.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A packet's Hop Limit determines how many times it can be forwarded before it is discarded. Each time a packet is forwarded, its Hop Limit value is decremented by one. When the Hop Limit reaches zero or when a router receives a packet with its Hop Limit set to zero, the packet is discarded and the source of the packet receives a Time Exceeded message indicating that the initial Hop Limit was too small or that the packet was caught in a routing loop.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#26](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#26)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#26](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#26)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#26](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#26)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property TimestampRepliesReceived As Long
public: abstract property long TimestampRepliesReceived { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Control Message Protocol version 4 (ICMPv4) Timestamp Reply messages that were received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of Timestamp Reply messages that were received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A Timestamp Request message causes the receiving computer to send a timestamp reply back to the originating computer. These messages are used to measure the transmission speed on a network.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#28](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#28)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#28](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#28)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#28](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#28)]

Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of Timestamp Request messages that were sent.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A Timestamp Request message causes the receiving computer to send a timestamp reply back to the originating computer. These messages are used to measure the transmission speed on a network.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#28](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#28)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#28](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#28)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#28](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#28)]
